ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Wind Radio/Plasma Wave, (WAVES) Radio Receiver Band 1 (RAD1) Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: Wind Waves RAD1 data in CDF format. Radio receiver band 1 (RAD1) is the low frequency radio astronomy receiver. It sweeps over the range of 20 to 1040 kHz with as many as 256 channels. However, some of the time the number of channels is restricted to 16 or 32 so that direction of arrival and polarization information can be obtained. Radio receiver band 2 (RAD2) is the high frequency radio astronomy receiver. It sweeps over the range of 1.075 to 13.825 MHz with as many as 256 channels. However, some of the time the number of channels is restricted to 16 or 32 so that direction of arrival and polarization information can be obtained. The overall frequency range is 4 - 256 kHz. For more information: The Radio and Plasma Wave Investigation on the Wind Spacecraft, Sp.Sci.Rev.,Vol 71, pg, 231-263,1995
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Users please acknowledge Coordinated Data Analysis Web (CDAWeb) at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center and Wind/Waves Principal Investigators, Dr. Karine Issautier (LIRA, Observatoire de Paris-PSL, CNRS) and Keith Goetz (Univeristy of Minnesota).

PublicationInfo.Authors: Issautier, Karine; Goetz, Keith A.; Macdowall, Robert J.; Bougeret, Jean-Louis H.; Bonnin, Xavier; Nguyen, Quyn Nhu; & Krupar, Vratislav

InformationURL.Name: WAVES Experiment on the Wind Spacecraft
InformationURL.Description: Wind/WAVES page maintained at NASA/GSFC with descriptions of the instrument, publications, examples of data, a form for requesting summary plots, Type II/IV event lists and access to numerical data in IDL save file format and ASCII format and IDL code.

InformationURL.Name: Wind Spacecraft Home Page
InformationURL.Description: Wind home page with description of instruments and access to data files.

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb
AccessURL.Description: Repository of Wind Waves CDF format at NASA CDAWeb, accessible via web interface. Name of the data resource: WI_L2_WAV_RAD1.

Parameter.Name: Frequency
Parameter.Description: Frequency measured by Radio receiver band 1 (RAD1).

Parameter.Name: Sequential Sweep Number
Parameter.Description: Sequential sweep number in the file.

Parameter.Name: Sequential Number
Parameter.Description: Sequential number in parent L2 data file.

Parameter.Name: S Receiver Background
Parameter.Description: S Receiver Background where S stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with no phase shift.

Parameter.Name: SP Receiver Background
Parameter.Description: SP Receiver Background where SP stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with a 90-deg phase shift.

Parameter.Name: Z Receiver Background
Parameter.Description: Z Receiver Background where Z is the measurement on the spin axis antenna.

Parameter.Name: S Time Offset
Parameter.Description: S Time Offset where S stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with no phase shift.

Parameter.Name: SP Time Offset
Parameter.Description: SP Time Offset where SP stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with a 90-deg phase shift.

Parameter.Name: Z Time Offset
Parameter.Description: Z Time Offset where Z is the measurement on the spin axis antenna.

Parameter.Name: S Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Description: S Power Spectral Density where S stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with no phase shift.

Parameter.Name: SP Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Description: SP Power Spectral Density where SP stands for the sum of Ex (or Ey) and Ez with a 90-deg phase shift.

Parameter.Name: Z Power Spectral Density
Parameter.Description: Z Power Spectral Density where Z is the measurement on the spin axis antenna.
